MaleStrings.String: Yes. However, disrupting vulnerable points in the infection may slow down its replication.
But it's vital they be rescued. They must complete their original mission. It's a matter of... galactic peace.
I appreciate your help... and understanding.
You said one of your ships had gone missing?
I'll do what I can.
Yes. Avoid contact.
Destroying higher processes, closing our exit.
You must hurry.
Reconnecting exit.
Rerouting pathways.
Error. Data not found.
Shepard-Commander. We urge you to hurry.
Insufficient memory. Connection terminating.
You mean it found us.
What's it doing?
It's over everything!
Legion?
What's wrong?
Hold on!
Commander, thank you for allowing me the use of your ship--and for going along with this plan.
Yes, Commander?
Alpha Team, Echo Team: fall back!
Get to your extraction zones.
I don't know if that's a compliment or not.
And for krogan, you need a very big stick.
Thank you! Thank you so much.
Have you heard from the admiral? He was trying to meet us. Did you see him?
No...
Shepard... my crew. Perhaps there's still time.
Hello? This is Zaal'Koris. Does anyone copy? Hello!
I pray they found comfort in the homeworld's skies.
We're picking up geth activity. Everyone on board. Now!
We've got to go.
Admiral! Come on!
Welcome aboard.
We've got to go.
Victus. His name's crossed my desk.
We have no data on this platform's previous ranged armament capabilities.
Grunt, got a body of a scout here. Been dead a few days.
Dagg, got a body of a scout here. Been dead a few days.
The prospect remains. If the Reaper presence is removed, there is a chance of reunification with geth--and perhaps creators.
Hope sustains organics during periods of difficulty. We... admire the concept.
It's not going to be easy.
You think that's still possible?
Is there something else I can help you with?
I'm sorry to say the asari councilor won't be joining us. She thinks there's too much bad blood with the krogan.
Light 'em up, Shepard.
Copy that, Commander!
Grunt, we got company!
Dagg, we got contact!
What the hell are my krogan dying for?
What are my krogan dying for?
Giving her time to escape!
That's going to complicate things.
So what happens now?
Then protect your civilians.
You'd better shield them.
We'll rendezvous there, and take an armored convoy against the Reaper.
After today, krogan superiority will be obvious to everyone.
Rare opportunity to improve galactic opinion of krogan. Hope you use it wisely.
Your strength was never in doubt. Only what you did with it.
And then the galaxy will have a new power to reckon with.
Did you see that? That's crazy!
Mars? Roger that.
Okay, everyone. Masks on. Weapons at the ready!
We're almost there.
What's a salarian doing here?
And so it begins! History will show that Clan Urdnot drew first Reaper blood.
They aren't welcome here!
Urdnot Wreav, brood brother to our...
...illustrious leader.
Wreav and I share the same mother. And nothing else.
For which I'm thankful. I remember what it means to be a true krogan.
We flay our enemies alive and drown them in a geyser of their own blood. We don't invite them into our home.
You didn't see what his kind did to our people. You weren't there, human.
There will be a reckoning for the genophage, Thurak, but not until I say so.
You agree with this, Wreav? We don't forgive our enemies!
And we never will, but the time for revenge doesn't begin until I say it does.
Now hold your heads high like true krogan!
And so will the rest of you.
Of course they do.
No time for bragging. The airstrike is on the way.
Farewell, Shepard. Fly safely.
And that's why I needed you to come back.
Yes, Commander?
Commander.
Well, let's hope it's enough.
I'll do what I can.
How could there be trouble with the rachni?
They were all but extinct. The last queen promised to disappear forever or be destroyed.
The last queen died years ago. They can't be back.
The rachni.
Which, if you'd asked, I could have told you before you destroyed Maelon's research, Shepard.
I know. I was there. I've got a bad feeling about this.
How could there be trouble with the rachni?
They were all but extinct. The last queen promised to disappear forever or be destroyed.
I watched the queen die. They can't be back.
The rachni.
There, it's open. We're clear to go.
Excellent. We're clear to proceed.
Yes, it's loaded and set for dispersal. Two minutes and counting.
Complications from the procedure. There were gaps in Maelon's technique I could never account for.
She was brave to the end. Despite her pain, she insisted we continue with the cure. I'm sorry.
Yes, it's loaded and set for dispersal. Two minutes and counting.
I believe so. Maleon's research was crucial in stabilizing her.
Together, she and Wrex can ensure a krogan future we need not fear. Evolution at its best.
Perhaps she'll keep Wreav's ambitions in check and ensure the worst of krogan history doesn't repeat.
It's the only way to repair the sabotage. I've already detected a temperature malfunction--the cure won't work unless this is fixed.
You don't. This is best left to me, Commander. You should get your team clear.
And has been since the day I met Eve.
Wiks! Is the cure ready?
What happened?
It's not your fault. I'm the one who destroyed Maelon's research.
Is she okay?
How do I do that?
But it's a one-way trip up there.
Padok, wait.
This is a one-way trip.
Narrow Passage
I see.
Well, should you wish to examine these geth to confirm their new allegiance, please do not hesitate to contact me.
Xen out.
Of course. If you would care to have me examine these geth--to verify their trustworthiness--I would gladly make time.
Thank you again for your services, Commander. Admiral Xen out.
They volunteered.
That was also the geth from the dreadnought.
That was all Legion's doing.
Raan, keep the civilians in formation! We can't lose the liveships!
Too risky, Raan. The Civilian Fleet needs support.
I suppose it is.
Your empathy is a weakness. You must numb yourself to loss.
Don't think about it, Doc. You just have to block out the dead.
It's why they're so unstoppable.
I prefer to spend my days killing the ones responsible.
My experience is war won't give you much of a choice.
Whatever's going on, it's well hidden.
I read about your mission on Noveria. Wasn't she indoctrinated?
And it didn't stop you in your tracks, did it? Like I said, you block that shit out.
I remember your mother. She fought so hard against indoctrination.
I remember your mother. She fought to break free of indoctrination.
I remember your mother. She fought indoctrination when it mattered most.
I remember your mother. She broke free of indoctrination when we needed it most.
I understand from past records that your mother was indoctrinated by the Reapers.
And this brings all those memories back. What if Thessia faces the same fate?
I hope you're right.
I'm sorry. I can't be that callous about my own people.
In our fight with the geth, I couldn't think about how many we lost.
If I did, I couldn't face the next day.
Sometimes we don't have a choice. I think about Earth long enough, and I go crazy.
Your emotion is understandable, but it will drain your energy to fight.
Not for long. We'll find the Catalyst and save Thessia.
I know it's difficult, Liara, but you can't think about it. You could spend all day counting casualties.
Sometimes war doesn't give us a choice.
We'll save them.
Block it out.
We need to pressurize the room first.
This is interesting. You should see this, Shepard.
{Chokes}
I don't know how you do it. You've always stayed focused, even in the worst situations.
No time to worry about that. We're exposed up here!
Worry about that later. We're exposed up here!
I'm concerned we're vulnerable up here.
Looks bad, but we can't stay up here. We're exposed!
You can't worry about that now. We're exposed up here!
You'll mourn later! Right now we're vulnerable up here!
I'm going to check on Ashley and James.
I'm going to check on Kaidan and James.
Make sure we're ready to present our findings to the Council.
Orders?
No she isn't!
The hell she is!
I got this one!
{Shouts}
Yeah, we're seeing them, too. We'll deal with it later. Getting to that Shroud is our priority.
More rachni.
It's the rachni again.
A dead rachni.
Looks like the rachni again.
What is that?
Wreav, those rumors you heard were true. We've got rachni here.
Let's get back to the Normandy.
I can sympathize with that.
I can sympathize with that.
Open Store
Close
I guess I just need some time to get to know you again.
Yeah. I thought so, too.
Thanks... for understanding.
We're at war with the Reapers. I thought it was obvious who the enemy was.
I'm the same person I always was. Time won't change that, but if that's what you need, I understand.
You bet.
Let's see if we can get that tram sent over here.
We're out of time.
I haven't changed.
I'm with you, Commander. I just wanted you to know why I--
I'm with you, Commander. I just wanted you to know why I'm--
Come on.
Let's see if we can get them to send that tram over.
I just want to know, is the person I followed to hell and back still in there... somewhere?
Probably not.
Me?
I'm with you.
Good.
They didn't change me, Kaidan. But words won't convince you, will they?
I didn't think so. You were always stubborn.
Cerberus brought me back to do one thing: stop the Reapers. You can join me, or you can leave, but you've gotta make up your mind.
Good to hear it.
Come on. Let's see what Cerberus is up to. Maybe we'll both get some answers.
I'm still here.
I am who I am.
And then we convince them that we're with them and the Alliance forces have been taken care of.
And we convince them that we're on their side, tell them the Alliance forces have been taken care of.
And?
And?

Prothean, huh? How do you know it'll finish the job?
You better know what you're doing.
Big place.
This would have taken considerable resources to build.
Big place.
Wow. Big place.
Check it out! Big place.
Impressive.
Impressive.
That's an order!
I need to create a bypass. That'll take time.
Yes. It's old tech. I know what to do.
Understood. Starting bypass.
And thank you for making sure I get this chance.
Are you sure you can disarm the trigger?
Just make it right, soldier.
Can you do this?
I advise haste, Commander.
We have to hurry, Shepard.
I hope Victus knows what he's doing. We won't get a second chance.
We gotta move, Shepard.
But we're running out of time.
We better keep moving.
More incoming!
More incoming!
More troops!
Here they come!
We got more!
More on the way!
More troops!
Here they come!
Cerberus won't risk us reaching the bomb. They won't stop.
I agree. They have little choice.
At least the guy went out in a blaze of glory.
To see the lieutenant die for us, for his platoon... it hits close to home.
I guess you're right.
Yes... of course, Shepard. I will reassess.
It already has.
It's a tough price to pay.
As it always does.
I agree.
What a waste.
Such a terrible cost.
Only question is, who's gonna pay the bill?
True enough. What war doesn't?
You're right, James. He died doing his duty.
I'm getting tired of seeing people die.
I hate losing people
Almost there!

Seems like a lot of trouble for a religion no one follows anymore.
Curious, considering no one practices the doctrine anymore.
Awful lot of trouble for a dead religion.
I'm impressed, but why all this effort for a dead religion?
Is it just me, or is this a lot of trouble for a dead religion?
Impressive. Especially considering no one practices her religion anymore.
What? You're sure?
But why hide it?
Think back to the one on Mars. Imagine what someone could learn if they kept this kind of thing quiet.
I would suggest your government is covertly extracting data from it.
From what you've told me about the one on Mars, these beacons are a mother-lode of information.
I wish we'd hidden the beacon back on Mars a little better. No telling what's in this one.
If it's anything like what we found on Mars, this could be the jackpot.
The one you found on Mars gave us the Crucible. Keeping this quiet makes sense.
This temple goes back thousands of years, Doc. Plenty of time to figure it out.
Your research did indicate this temple is several millennia old, Dr. T'Soni.
You did say this temple was thousands of years old, Liara. That's a lot of time to study it.
You did say this temple was thousands of years old, Liara.
And you did say this place has been around awhile, Doc.
You did say this temple is thousands of years old, Liara. Lots of time to study it.
There's a Prothean beacon here.
It's not something you forget.
Admiral. They're asking for you.
I asked the Major to come. Thought you might want to see a familiar face.
I asked the lieutenant-commander to come. Thought you might want to see a familiar face.
You know the Commander?
I used to.
I used to.
Major?
Lieutenant-Commander?
Sounds good.
Commander.
Not supposed to salute you, either...
Couldn't say. Just told me they needed you... now.
You're not supposed to call me that anymore, James.
What's going on?
Can we really stop them?
This is going to be brutal.
I hope we're ready.
Tali, no!
Try to raise him.
Also, there are pockets of my men scattered along the crash trajectory.
Damn. At least she went out fighting.
It appears crash survivors had to engage the geth.
The geth probably came over the ridge. Not much of a fight.
A ship full of civilians... They never had a chance.
These poor people. They never had a chance.
Geth didn't waste time hunting these people down.
The machines have begun hunting the quarians.
They came so far.
We need to radio Zaal'Koris if we're going to find him. Let's get to that jamming tower.
Hope the admiral's worth a wartime search and rescue, Commander.
Hopefully we track down this admiral before the geth do.
We'll see in a minute. Take us in to the tower.
We're approaching the quarian home system. ETA to Rannoch: five minutes.
Pretty much a big ol' shitstorm, Commander.
I have detected several hundred unique ship signatures engaged in active combat.
Yeah, like I said.
What've you got from the comm buoys?
Be happy we haven't run into a geth armature.
Will do, ma'am.
Geth everywhere, civilians in trouble... Remind you of anything?
So much for the Alliance's story about the geth being wiped out.
The geth just keep coming like... well--
Were you around when the Alliance claimed we'd wiped out the last major geth outposts?
Eden Prime?
No one knew how many geth were still behind the Perseus Veil.
Machines?
Yeah, intel was always a little underfunded.
Combat Drone
Shepard, there is a problem. All tubes except one are physically secured.
I see the free one. Pretty torn up, though.
Roger that, Commander. We'll just stay here--you know--quietly.
Sounds like a plan.
Good to see you again, Lieutenant-Commander Williams.
You sure about that?
Absolutely. I wish you two nothing but happiness, Ash.
Any reason I shouldn't be?
No. No, it's good to have you back.
Thanks. Ready to go shoot some geth?
Oh, hell yes.
Definitely. We're all adults here.
Of course. Oh, and congratulations on getting your big-girl name.
Thanks! I'm so glad you decided to help Shepard this time.
Let's go shoot something.
There's no one I'd trust more in a fight, Ash.
Oh. Well... thanks.
Come on. Let's go shoot some geth.
I think we've got enough history to drop rank, Tali.
Thanks, Ash. Ready to go shoot some geth?
Just like old times.
Your expertise with the geth is a welcome addition, Tali.
EDI. So... a body?
It has proven useful. I hope it doesn't cause you concern.
Not unless you go crazy and decide to overthrow the humans.
If I decide to overthrow the humans, you will be the first to know.
Good to have you back, Tali. Maybe with another dextro aboard, they'll get better turian food.
As long as it's sterilized.
Dr. Michel did get me some dextro-amino chocolate. You're welcome to it, once we're back.
She got you turian chocolate?
She said she saw it and thought of me. Why?
Watch yourself, Shepard.
Oh, nothing.
Good to see you again, Tali.
You too, Kaidan. How's the omni-tool? Still using the Logic Arrest?
It's still the best model.
Not for running multiple attack processes simultaneously. You need a Nexus.
Nexus shield enhancements are years behind the curve!
That's why you overclock the microframe.
We couldn't ask for a better expert.
Thanks... Shadow Broker.
Speaking of which, I see a lot of things in my new position.
I've heard a few things, myself. Don't worry. I hope you and Shepard are happy together.
Anything we need to discuss?
No. I just hope you two are happy.
Thanks. Ready to hit the dreadnought?
Yes.
See anything interesting?
Relic technology interface, radiation diagnostics, omni-tool upgrade--all authorized by Project Haestrom.
Hey, where'd you get--
NutriScan 2.2, EnginMaster 3.6: Human Vessels Edition... Nerve-Stim Pro?
I can imagine. The temptation to violate your friends' privacy must be unbearable.
You get used to it.
Ready to infiltrate the dreadnought?
I think we can drop ranks... Admiral.
Good.
So you're a real living Prothean?
As opposed to a fake dead one?
Uh... okay.
Nice to meet you, Sparks.
Sparks?
Yeah, you've got lights in your... uh. And you're kinda small and jumpy. It just came out.
If you say so.
Too risky for the whole team. I'll secure the docking area. Everyone else can follow me over.
All right, once we're aboard, we find whatever's broadcasting the Reaper signal and shut it down.
Tali's our expert on geth software. She'll be handling hacking and security.
With luck, we're in and out before the geth know we're there.
Admiral Xen will be here in a minute. She'll be handling hacking and security.
Sentry Turret
Admiral, we've lost contact with Luna Base.
How'd they get past our defenses?
Sir, UK headquarters has a visual.
Why haven't we heard from Admiral Hackett?
What do we do?
Except maybe the quarians.
Thank you, Tali. It means a lot to hear you say that.
Let's go hit that dreadnought.
Whenever you're ready.
Indeed.
The shuttle can't take any more damage!
Shuttle's going to blow if we take another hit!
The admiral's outgunned down there!
Geth closing in on the admiral!
Those civilians are outgunned!
Civilians need help, Commander!
I've got this.
Will do.
Hurry it up.
Wrex, you and Mordin stay with Eve. It's looking ugly out here!
Wrex, you and Padok stay with Eve. It's looking ugly out here!
Wreav, you and Mordin stay with Eve. It's looking ugly out here!
Wreav, you and Padok stay with Eve. It's looking ugly out here!
Let's play Mass Effect™ 3 together!
Mass Effect™ 3
What else, EDI?
Hang tight. It'll just be a minute.
OK
Geth incoming! We can't hold position for long!
Taking heavy fire! We need a target!
I need to get the fleet into position for another bombardment!
Hang on, Commander. We're not in position!
Evasive maneuvers!
That would provide ample time to learn its secrets.
Plenty of opportunity to crack its secrets.
Keep it under wraps, and there's no telling what your people could learn.
It wouldn't take much. A breakthrough here, a breakthrough there, and pretty soon you're top dog in the galaxy.
Too bad they didn't tell you.
Even just a few technological advances would give your species an edge over others.
Which history would seem to support.
But think about it: a scientific breakthrough every couple centuries, and your people would be running the galaxy.
Which they pretty much do.
But it would explain a lot. A couple breakthroughs every other century and the asari stay on top.
Maybe this is why.
Why deny it? I'd be proud. Steal a nugget from this thing every now and then and you're running the galaxy.
Which you already do, don't you?
But very likely. It would only take a few scientific advances to give the asari an edge over others.
Which, I'd like to point out, you now have.
The activation process has begun.
Maybe that's the point...
The geth are helpless! Press the attack!
Keep firing! Today we reclaim our homeworld!
Bring the Civilian Fleet in! We can finish this now!
What the hell was that?
We've got energy spikes on all geth ships!
That's crazy! Shepard, you can't do this.
That kind of tech isn't even on the market. This can't be safe.
My people are noncombatants, Shepard! They'll be slaughtered! Rescue them.
Thank you. I have only one request.
It is more important you honor my last request.
Do what I could not: save my people from themselves.
May the fleet be worthy of these sacrifices.
Civilians? Our entire race took up arms for this insanity! It's too late for us.
You can't possibly think you can stop this war!
My people are down here!
I cannot abandon my crew!
Ancestors, forgive me. Uploading my coordinates.
I copy. We'll protect them, and I'll make sure the Civilian Fleet is taken care of, Admiral.
The Civilian Fleet will know their leader went down fighting, Admiral.
Admiral, I need you leading the Civilian Fleet if we're going to end this fight.
It's only too late if you die down here!
I don't know. What I do know is that I can't do it without your help.
So your ship goes down and you give up? Your people are fighting for their lives up there!
The entire Civilian Fleet's depending on you! Who's going to look out for them, Admiral Gerrel? Xen?
We save dozens now or millions later. Your decision, Admiral.
We're coming.
We'll save them.
Your people will be proud.
We need a peacemaker.
You're a coward.
Over here.
This way.
Over here.
This way.
Over here.
This way.
This way.
Come this way.

Shepard! Are you okay?
Are you all right, Commander?
I find that a bit hard to believe.
But we just beat them!
Turian Soldier
Commander Shepard, my men and I are in your debt.
What's left of them.
He screwed up!
Stand down, soldier!
These men are dead because of him!
I said, stand down!
I made a bad call. This is all on me.
Yes. We could see on holo that Reaper forces were blocking our intended path--staying on-course guaranteed heavy casualties.
So I chose a safer route, skirting the enemy, and that took us low and through these ruins. When we encountered resistance, there was no room to maneuver.
Suddenly, we were in a fight for our lives. A lot of my men lost that fight.
Of course... it's just fresh right now.
You're right, Commander.
Our mission's still a failure. When we've stabilized the injured, we'll head back to the fleet.
We're down over thirty men. It'd be suicide.
There's a bomb on the planet. We were sent to defuse it.
Enormous. Cerberus has it.
Haven't these men sacrificed enough?
My men have lost hope, Commander. Even if I wanted to finish the mission, they don't.
How?
Men! I own what happened here today, but we have to carry on!
We are turian, and we will not let Cerberus succeed. Our sacrifice is the difference between life and death for this entire galaxy!
Let the heroes of the Ninth Platoon be remembered for performing their duties with bravery!
All right, men! Shuttles are arriving any minute--we're moving out!
Listen up! This isn't about your fears and grievances!
Irrelevant! Court-martial, death, and dishonor await anyone who balks at his duty.
We are turian! We finish what we came here to do, or we die trying!
Commander? Come with us.
We're a shell of what we were--we could use the help.
Thank you. That'll give us time to do a little recon, see what we're up against.
Understood, Commander. Hope to see you at the rendezvous.
Lieutenant Victus?
What happened here?
Hey! I just saved all your asses, so everyone just calm down!
Lieutenant, what's going on here?
You mean the crash?
Owning your mistake takes guts. But you have to get over it and move on.
Making hard decisions and dealing with the consequences--that's what being a leader is about.
You're abandoning your mission?
What exactly did you come here to do?
A bomb? How big?
Lieutenant, if Cerberus has that bomb, you have to finish your mission.
I understand. This kind of sacrifice is the hardest to ask for, but your men signed on for it, and so did you.
It's your job to make them want to.
Their sacrifice means that others will never face what they faced here today. Remind them that those sacrifices have no honor if the mission fails.
What's wrong with you? Inspire them! Threaten them! Lieutenant, if Cerberus succeeds, the Reapers divide and conquer us! And then that is on them.
Send me the NavPoint. I'll see what I can do.
Victus, I've given you a second chance--don't screw this up.
What did you do?
Bad calls happen.
Get over it.
Appeal to their honor.
Kick their asses!
Quarian Corpse
MP Maps (Dev)
Private Match
Quick Match
They know we're coming, and I bet they're in a fighting mood.
Keep that anger, Liara. Use it.
Anger can provide you strength. Organics are fortunate in this regard.
Stay angry. We'll need it to get through this.
Hang on to that anger. It's what keeps me going.
Use your anger against the enemy, Liara.
It's how I faced the geth.
Use that anger!
Here they come.
Programming the bypass!
Maybe giant insects are liars like everyone else?
We've got more hostiles ahead!
More enemies ahead!
More of them ahead!
More of them ahead!
Hostiles ahead!
More ahead!
They don't quit without a fight, do they?
Not even when you think they're extinct.
Let's hope they're saying the same about us.
It's not Cerberus, Commander. It's... turian.
Hedging your bets, huh?
Given their history, a wise measure.
To keep the krogan from becoming a threat.
The turians wanted a way to keep the krogan in check.
Insurance against further krogan aggression.
Brutal, but it makes a certain kind of sense. Put the krogan down hard if they tried anything.
To keep the krogan in check.
They were wary of a future krogan threat.
Talk to me about this Cerberus bomb.
What do you mean, "turian?"
Copy that, Lieutenant.
Buy me a few minutes, Commander.
Then return the favor.
Then kill twice as many of them.
Then you give it back to them twice as hard.
Then avenge them.
Then let's slaughter a few of them back.
Not if we kill them first.
Ahead to the left--snipers on the balcony.
Up ahead on the left--snipers on the balcony.
Ahead to the left--snipers on the balcony.

Badassfully, that badge is the only thing keeping him from killing you right now.
You be sorry!
This one is already sorry. It will take hours to remove your olfactory residue from my oxygen diffusion membrane. Let us depart, Bubin.
Badassfully, what the hell did that accomplish.
Two things. First, the vorcha knows we are following it.
Badassfully, and second.
You have demonstrated that you still possess a supportive endoskeleton.
Coquettishly, that's right, baby. Tell me your soul name.
It is whatever you wish it to be, polyp.
Badassfully, what the hell is going on here. Are you sleeping with my sister.
Slumber would be difficult due to the energetic nature of our copulation.
Badassfully, damn it, Blasto, that's it. You and me, outside, right now.
Coquettishly, please don't hurt him.
This one promises not to harm your brother.
Badassfully, I didn't ask to be partnered with you, Blasto.
No solid-waste excrement. You dislike the manner in which this Spectre operates.
Badassfully, no, you're one of the best damn cops I've worked with.
Then what is the difficulty? Aside from your sister.
Badassfully, the problem is that I can't work with a partner who doesn't respect me.
This one greatly respects you. But you care more about protocol than stopping the vorcha.
Badassfully, doing it by the book is what separates us from them.
Ha-ha! Kill you now!
Spawn of questionable parentage. The vorcha. Get to cover.
Badassfully, damn it, Blasto. They got me. They got me bad.
No, Bubin. You are too aesthetically displeasing to die.
Badassfully, promise me you'll get the vorcha.
They have already perished, though they are currently unaware of it.
Badassfully, no. By the book. Promise me you'll do it by the book.
This one cannot accede to this request.
Badassfully, promise me, damn it. Promise--Translator Error, obstruction in airway.
Nooo.
Commander Shepard, I was just contacted by a black market dealer who's donating high-end weapons to C-Sec.
He wanted you to know. Sounds like you came through.
Commander. Unless you can find a new source of weapons for C-Sec, I'm putting together a task force to stop the Blue Suns myself.
Commander Shepard.
I need to do my part for the Citadel, Commander. The Blue Suns are raiding C-Sec weapons shipments. I'm putting a stop to that.
You don't think I've tried? There's a black market dealer on Citadel right now, but he won't sell his top-line arms.
You think I'm afraid of death? Palaven is in ruins. My people are dying by the millions.
Let me see what I can do for you.
The Blue Suns can make life difficult for you. Impossible, even.
Excuse me, General.
I'll get weapons for you.
Walk away from this.
[Place a kill order on Oraka]
Whoa, these are nice. Yeah, real nice.
Done deal, Commander. Check in with General Oraka--you'll see I'm making C-Sec very happy.
Look, Commander, I don't want any trouble. I'm authorized to sell here. And all my arms are legal, see?
Yeah, I got much better stuff, but it's off the market. Galaxy's going belly-up--credit won't mean anything once the Reapers rip through.
Heh. The turian just waved credits in my face and then spat on it. Nice to see you have flexibility.
Whatever happens, I figure there'll be survivors--but it'll be chaos. I'm betting things will run on a barter system.
I-I'm sure you could. But even if you rough me up, or--or kill me, my partners won't release the weapons without my okay.
Here, I've got some pieces for you.
These are light weight weapons. Where's your top-end inventory?
So, what gets me access to your top-shelf?
So, what exactly are you saying?
These weapons are for the war. If you don't do your part, I could make your life very unhappy.
What will you take?
What do you mean?
I'm not asking.
Me give you money!
Coquettishly, you didn't say anything about attacking my brother.
Brother? Rah! Me no pay you! My men kill you instead!
Apologies, but your men had to catch a skycar.
Blasto! How you find me?
By following Bubin's sister. It was obvious she helped your men plan the ambush.
You no kill me! Diplomatic immunity!
Yes. This one made a promise to do it by the book. You may only be killed in self-defense.
Rah, you no see my gun! Ha!
You are standing on flammable material. This one has no choice...
Aaah!
...but to enkindle this.
Coquettishly, what are you going to do with me.
Nothing. The vorcha kidnapped you to lure me in. That is all this one saw.
Coquettishly, you don't have to protect me.
No. But your brother needs blood from a family member to survive. And indicted criminals cannot make tissue donations.
Coquettishly, what. Bubin's alive.
Barely. And not for long. So cease talking and get to the hospital.
Coquettishly, thank you, Blasto. Thank you for breaking the rules for me.
Polyp, when has this one ever been concerned with the rules?
You do not retire for another two solar days, Bubin. Please refrain from sleeping on the job.
Badassfully, ugh, what happened.
We got the vorcha. By the book.
Blasto! The entire vorcha embassy burned down!
Do you see how my suit is bulging? It's because the turian councilor is in here with me, up my cloaca. He's not happy.
Nobody would be happy lodged in your cloaca, Chief.
You're lucky Bubin's sister can testify that you killed him in self-defense! Do you know how much paperwork you're going to have?
My partner can take care of it. He is still restricted to desk duty for health reasons.
